channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 40 to 50tonne waste dumped from building site ., 30th June
item.description:
This waste I believe has been dumped from the adjacent site 51 Charlton church lane , The main issue apart from the dumping of the waste is one of huge safety for the Tennants bordering this property boundary the brick retaining wall is in danger of collapsing into adjacent properties in Floyd road ., the wall has a lean on it of 15 to 20 % . Could you please advise what can be done . There is real danger of someone being seriously hurt and massive property damage . Total disregard for people. Safety buy whoever has dumped this waste here .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Floyd Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped black sacks containing used helium canisters, 30th June

item.title: Graffiti, 30th June
item.description:
Outside Asda on Broadway, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove the white graffiti on top of a black public litter bin - picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Broadway, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London

item.title: Trip hazard to members of public. Paving stone loose and wobbly with concrete post about to fall over at some point. I fell over and hurt myself.I was walking home past the concrete post and slab in the area and tripped and fell.There is no accommodation for excess for lack of maintenance and I will be taking legal action if this is not dealt with., 30th June
item.description:
Trip hazard to members of public there is a large number of elderly people live in this area get this fixed ASAP. Hackney Council leaving parts of the estate in disrepair not doing their duty.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osborne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working - not fixed yet, 30th June
item.description:
Since a couple of weeks all the lights on the poles stopped working. there are still other wall lights but are very dim so the whole area now is dark and feel very unsafe. There are often homeless people loitering in the area so can we please prioritise this? It was marked as fixed but the lights are still off! some of them are on during the day and off during the night or they lights very briefely at odds hour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1 - 12, Blissett Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unhygienic Rubbish Storage, 30th June
item.description:
These people do not store their rubbish properly. 1 day after bin collection, the area is a mess, rubbish not stored securely, attracting pests and it smells (worse now in summer). They have been warned numerous times and do not improve.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): College Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously cut large tree, 30th June
item.description:
Outside 877 879 East Rochester Way a large tree on the verge between A2 and the pavement. The trunk of this tree has been partially cut through about 2ft from ground , with a chainsaw. If there are high winds, it might fall either onto the pavement or onto the A2.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 897, East Rochester Way, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other area rubbish is been deposited in our bins, 30th June
item.description:
